Reviews.Title: “glad we found the Griffon!”
Reviews.Author: jane_birkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights this month and really liked the place. Stylish but not over the top. It was extremely clean, which is very important to me as i have severe allergies to dust. Front desk was solicitous and helpful, got good directions from the bellman/valet. I had the King room and did not find it too small. Bed was very comfortable. I was most impressed because my room was right next to the elevator but it wasn't loud at all. The wireless connection actually worked smoothly, unlike lots of other hotels with free wireless. Very convenient to the Bay Bridge and local transportation. The Griffon has a local bar/restaurant chain called Perry's in the lobby, which was crowded with people at lunch, happy hour and dinner, unlike other hotel restaurants. Parking is pricey though--$40 with tax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilderton
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate with Travel Ticker that included free valet parking (although it was necessary to point this fact out on both check in and check out). That said we were warmly welcomed and given a small but beautifully furnished room that contained everything that you could wish for. We were staying for just the one night but found the location just right. The Embarcadero was just across the street and the walk down the Piers was very enjoyable - although it took 40mins to get to Pier 39. Returning late in the evening chef was stiff OK to put a bar meal together. The free to use Internet terminal in the lobby was a bonus as was the first class buffet continental breakfast. I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Nikho
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Clean and cozy - Great front desk staff - On-site bar/restaurant - Location virtually on the Embarcadero and within walking distance to at least half a dozen restaurants. Cons: - The rooms can be a bit cozy for two people - The sink is in front of the bed I stayed at this hotel on the suggestion of a co-worker for a business trip. It's location makes it a great place to stay as you can walk to the Embarcadero at night and walk off to Market during the day where there's plenty of other things to see and do. The bar/restaurant on site was closed for remodeling when I visited but my co-worker says that it's a great place to lounge around so I thought I'd share his insights.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid -- does not honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: nyc10010
Reviews.Content: I certainly echo the other comments about the lack of customer service and the unprofessional front desk. This hotel persistently does not honor confirmed reservations and attempts to send those customers that it turns away to substandard hotels such as the Hotel Fitzgerald. In addition, its personnel falsely claimed that there were no other hotels available in San Francisco when Hotels.com was able after a perfunctory search to locate a number of available rooms in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, great location, perfect for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: patuk104
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a day and we had a great time. The restaurant was under renovation so we heard a little bit of construction in the morning. Rooms are tiny, but do the trick if you don't plan on spending much time in them. Very nice mounted flat screen tv. Location was awesome, right next to MUNI, BART, etc. About 1.3 miles of Pier 39. Parking is valet only, 40 bucks a night. Overall, great if you're looking for a place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and horrible guestrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Mr_MartinOC
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here as it looked nice on website and appeared to be in good area and were advertising a good deal for a room with Bay view. Ok. Well, upon arrival desk staff treated us like dirt, manager argued with us and also expedia rep, and refused to give us the room we had paid for. They were so awful, I have never seen something like it before - absolutely awful staff at front desk, including the manager. They finally gave us our room after waiting, arguing and having to go through a humiliating experience in the lobby. The guestroom was small and not very nice, and there is lots of noise from the street. Please do not stay here, they do not deserve to be in business in such a nice city like San Francisco. I hope they go out of business. Do not stay here, you will hate it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Griffon”
Reviews.Author: legend87
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for spacious rooms and top-notch customer service, I'm sure there are plenty of places to stay in San Francisco. Unfortunately, this isn't one of them. On the good side - the location is excellent - with TONS of things within walking distance. The bellmen were very helpful and always willing to answer questions. Unfortunately, the front desk is a mess. Customer service is not the priority at Hotel Griffon. Late checkins seemed to be quite common there, so don't expect to check in at 3:00, as advertised. Also, when they fill up they will change the room rate. Although we had reservations at $200/night, they charged us $270 for one of the nights because they filled up. It took several minutes of arguing with the manager to get this reversed. If you are a light sleeper, this is not the place for you either. You will hear every single thing going on in the hall and every door slam. The view from our window was terrible (I posted a picture). Its really a shame, because this could be a great place to stay. I wish I had read more reviews before we booked there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: exebeth
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The room was small but really cozy and comfortable, and very quiet. The location is great, right across from the Ferry Market Building, and interesting restaurants. I had a great time, and am planning to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Joemugg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Griffon during a recent weekend catching up with some college friends. I booked after careful consideration of the reviews, and also because I was able to secure a great price. Think I paid 100 dollars. I arrived in a rainstorm, and was warmly and professionally greeted, and welcomed to my room 416. The hotel has a boutique feel without the boutique price, and the rooms are small but well-appointed. It's perfect for one person, to luxuriate. The rooms have earthtone schemes, an abundance of fabric but not too fussy at all. The wall-mounted plasma screen was cool. As was the silky, clean robes. I also enjoyed the many complimentary sundry items such as the Aveda products, and Wolfgang Puck coffee. Basically, I just hung out watching TV and drinking hot coffee, and it felt great, a nice antidote to being out in the City. Previous posters have mentioned the dim lighting'; there are multiple lighting sources in the room that overall illuminate the room's sexy/intimate character. It's dim/sexy not dim/dingy. I didn't feel as though the hotel was hiding any flaws using this lighting plan. The rooms are extremely clean and are fragrance-free. Note room 418 faces the Bay, and Bay Bridge and seems especially romantic. The hotel only has five stories btw. 418 may be a junior suite or what not but may be worth the additional expense if traveling with a spouse or companion and wanting to wow and luxuriate. I will definitely stay at the Griffon again when my plans take me North.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A_Light_Sleeper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a recent business trip, just needed a nice, comfortable place to stay in town. Been to SF many times, downtown hotels are usually long on price and short on value. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Room was small but met all my needs. Bed very comfortable, large flat screen TV mounted on the wall. Amenities were plenty, free breakfast bar in the morning offered treats and pretty good coffee. Staff very friendly and accommodating. Great value considering it's right offm arket St. which makes getting anywhere easy. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kalian7
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hotel Griffon via the airport shuttle and had been flying for quite some time so I was extremely pleased when I went to grab my bags and I was told to just leave them and that they were being taken care of - great service! Check-in was great and I was offered good advice on places to eat in the area. Talk about location! I stayed in SF previously, but at different hotels and wish I would have stumbled upon the Hotel Griffon first. The room is very "quaint," but for a single traveler, it's just what I need. The bathroom amenities are definitely good quality as well. I've only been here a day so I have yet to try the continental breakfast and haven't ventured around the hotel much. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: “Two separate stays - one great experience”
Reviews.Author: Vickster01Sydney
Reviews.Content: For a single, female traveller, this hotel truly met my needs with a very central location to all sorts of transport, walking distance to several key sites and easy access to restaurants of all tastes and budgets as well as local atmosphere. After contacting the property direct, I got a better rate for my first two nights, which they extended to a third night three weeks later. My rooms were small, sure, but this was OK for one person. My room had no views, and the window looking out to a small courtyard surrounded by other rooms - no problem, as I got out to enjoy the views! Rooms were well-appointed with a modern decor, large plasma TV, lovely Aveda toiletry products and a large, comfortable bed. Service was friendly, and Kevin and Sam, the porters/concierges, were fantastic. Also located one block from nightly markets, an open ice skating rink around Christmas, great close-up views of the Bay Bridge and also The Ferry Building (an beautifully old restored building which is one of several ferry stops and has various restaurants as well as retail shops for great browsing), it should suit all tastes and budgets. I also enjoyed the close location to the financial district, as I was across the street from a post office and within walking distance to many other services, including banks, an AT&T shop for mobile phone service, a great bagel cafe, Noah's, the BART system (for an easy trip from the airport) and one of the cable lines. The free internet access for hote guests was a bonus, and the continental breakfast was more than just cold croissants and coffee, with healthy options and great service. Finally, on my last day I was not feeling well, and they gladly extended my check-out to 1.00. My bags were later stored in a separate room behind the counter, so I felt they were secure while I explored during the day and came back at 6 pm for my shuttle to the airport. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed--stick with Kimpton!”
Reviews.Author: ragtoplover
Reviews.Content: Greatly disappointed in this small hotel. Compared with other small, boutique hotels in the city (specifically the Kimpton Brand Hotels), this hotel fell far short. The level of service was mediocre. The front desk was the biggest problem--highly unprofessional. Nobody offered luggage assistance, the concierge was never to be seen. We asked for directions and they were all wrong, twice. The first time, the front desk clerk didn't even know their street ends one block from the hotel (he seemed to pretend to be looking at a map). The second time we checked a map to confirm the written directions (we're not fools) and again found they were wrong. We gladly would have traded the cookies for a second bar of soap. It took so long to get a second bar of soap to the room, we just shared the one between the sink and the shower (also not thrilled that the sink/vanity is in the bed area and not the bathroom). All the trappings, little substance.

Reviews.Title: “OK, would consider again”
Reviews.Author: LalaLaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not great, but it is not awful either. My boyfriend and I decided to book a room for one night since we did not want to drive home after a holiday party. The hotel served its purpose, it provided a clean and nice room to stay overnight. I would not consider this hotel if I was on vacation or staying for a longer trip. The rooms are very small and the service is lacking in some areas. We paid $118 for the room which I thought was very reasonable considering the area and the location. Since we were staying overnight, the size of the room and the lack of lighting was ebdurable. However, if I had stayed longer then that I would find the room stifling and a bit sad since the view to our window was of a wall. The location is great because you are close to some great restaurants like Ozumo, Boulevard, and the Ferry Building. If I am ever in the city again and need a place to just sleep I would consider this hotel again since it was inexpensive. It would not be worth it to me to pay more than $120 a night to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch routine on Hotel Griffon room rates”
Reviews.Author: Rkatsiteli
Reviews.Content: Classic bait-and-switch. The room rate they charged me was $20/night more than what they "guaranteed" when I made the reservation on their reservations website. I disputed this with the front desk clerk (showing him a copy of the original confirmation), who asserted that he couldn't do anything about it because there was no manager on duty until 8:30 a.m. He "promised" to raise it with the manager, but as he wrote down notes I could see that we was lying and his notes had no resemblance to our discussion. The facilities are pleasant enough, but there were at least two other problems: - the "free wireless internet service" doesn't reach the 3rd floor; and the old T-1 wiring connection has been disabled - Housekeeping isn't particularly thorough--there was a gross stain on the brown bedspread (blood? coffee? semen? mucus?). Yuck. At the originally promised room rate, this might be a good-enough lower end value-for-money hotel within walking distance of the Embarcadero. As it is, I'd suggest that it's unwise to patronize hotels that bait and switch on room rates. On most weeknights and with enough advance planning, the Hyatt Regency down the street has rooms for comparable rates (to the actual higher charged price) that offer more consistent quality if less funky atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: noelmal
Reviews.Content: We loved being so close to the Ferry building and some great restaurants. The Farmer's Market on Saturday was such a great venue for people watching, not to mention the amazing food. Rooms are very small, and most do not have a view of anything except walls or other windows. The rooms are almost too small for two people because of the lack of storage space for two suitcases. Closet is tiny and there is not a dresser. Lighting is not good and there is not a full length mirror. If you expect a high level of service then this is not the hotel for you. Staff is friendly but not polished. Room maintance and housekeeping are average - visiable defects but no real deal breakers. The breakfast was good with fresh pastries, bagels, juice and cereals. Room decor and public space decor is comfortable. We got a good rate (about $150 a night) and we booked it for the location so we were pleased overall with the value that we received.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jptChicago
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY LOVED THE HOTEL GRIFFON! Just returned from a lengthy northern California trip and i can say that my stay at the Griffon was the highlight. Yes the rooms are small but this is an old school hotel and the rate was about half of what I found elsewhere. the location is fantastic and the area has tons of great restaurants and bars. FYI, Mexico DF next door serves food until 1am and the Rincon market on the corner of howard and spear has everything you would need food wise to stock your fridge. I would definetly stay here again! Also, take the California street cable car up to Union Square and get a seat at the cafe on the front sidewalk of the Macy's Mens store. Best people watching in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: TigermomPDX
Reviews.Content: I called and booked the reservation directly as part of a group with PG&E. When I arrived they had me down as a "no show" on the wrong date, and had no other rooms available. My confirmation number was worthless, even though I figured out what happened - I booked on the 17th of Auguest for the 19th of Sept - they put down the 17th of Sept. They told me I could either wait 3 hours and see if there was a cancellation or they would call next door . Ultimately they did make an attempt to help me find another hotel - at over 2 times the Griffon's cost, but when I went back to check on cancellations the man wouldn't even slow down and look at us directly - apparently couldn't be bothered. Said I should have gotten an email confirmation - which I didn't - I checked. Try being in downtown San Francisco, with a Microsoft conference in town and no hotel! I learned a lesson about boutique hotels on this trip - keep with the ones who might possibly have a back up plan , or an alternative property., or a reciprocity arrangement. Our group contact was not surprised I had no email confirmation - that is the norm. I was surprised at the attitude of the gentleman at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cburch22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night (a Saturday night). The location could not be beat- it was a block and a half from the Embarcadero and ferry buildings. We've been to San Fran a few times before but had never ventured down to this area. The farmers market there on the weekend was amazing and it was fun to spend an hour or two just wandering around, taking it all in. We took a ferry from there to Sausalito for lunch at Horizon's (great food, great atmosphere with outside seating right on the water- was perfect!) and then ate dinner at the Hotel's restaurant- Faz. Great italian food with a view of the Bay Bridge. Very romantic. The hotel room was small, as most boutique rooms are, but clean and nice. The free breakfast was very well done. Everyone there was very nice and helpful. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mpartyp
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. The Hotel Griffon is a very nice boutique hotel located in the financial district. The rooms are small, but newly renovated and quite comfortable. The staff was extremely nice and willing to please. There are a lot of very nice restaurants within walking distance, especially Cosmopolitan. The ferry building is around the corner and the bus lines that run up Market to Union Square are within a couple of blocks. The Hotel lowered their on-line price after I had made reservations. When I inquired about getting the new discounted rate they were more than happy to accommodate me.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and cute (small) room, but slow valet”
Reviews.Author: FreddieBSeattle
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone for business, and the location was perfect. The room was really small (see photos), but that was fine by me as I was travelling alone and didn't spend much time in my room (plus it still felt really cozy). I really liked the exposed brick, and thought they did a good job decorating the room. I had no view (literally looked at a wall), but that was ok. The only time I really noticed the room being small was when room service showed up and I had nowhere to really eat my food! The valet service is really too slow (15 mintues for your car), so leave lots of time for that. But the staff is incredibly friendly. I ate next door at the trendy, crowded Japanese place "Ozumo" and enjoyed the people watching and yummy sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: GalenaGuy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Griffon is in an excellent location near the Ferry Building. The rates are reasonable ($164 on hotel website). I don't recommend it, however, as there are many nicer hotels in San Francisco. When I arrived after a long drive from southern California, the front desk clerk suggested I go out and park my own car on the street. I had to ask twice for the car to be parked -- I was tired, it was almost midnight and the neighborhood was new to me. There was no bellman, no greeter. The next morning, when 9 a.m. and the end of the complimentary breakfast arrived, the cleaning crew swooped all the food, coffee and hot water away, and took the guests' plates, etc. even though several people were still enjoying coffee with a newspaper, etc. The staff didn't ask if anyone wanted more coffee, or leave the coffee for refills. Very rude. The in room temperature control didn't work, neither did the ice machine. With poor service and an indifferent staff, the incredible location and decent price can't save this hotel from a mediocre rating.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL rooms at Hotel Griffon!”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler404
Reviews.Content: Hotel Griffon has a cute charm to it, but I would only stay here again if the price was very low and I was not planning on spending a lot of time in the room. Pros: Cute, historic charm. Nice exposed brick wall in room and great Aveda bath products. Good location, although we usually had to walk a block or two to get a cab. Continental breakfast was nice. Everything appeared very clean. I requested more towels and they were sent up quickly. We were very impressed with all of the staff, including the front desk, in the restaurant, and at breakfast. Cons: Many people said small rooms, which usually donâ€™t bother me, but our room was beyond small. I actually felt a little claustrophobic because the window looked out into a very small, dark, dirty brick cave-like hole. There are also very few king beds because many of the rooms are too small to accommodate them. Despite booking months in advance and requesting a king bed multiple times, I could only get a full bed. The rooms must also be all different sizes because I was with other people who paid the same rate and both had slightly larger rooms so you may get the luck of the draw on your room. The sink and mirror in the room was a little strange but at least there was good counter space. The location of the TV mounted on the wall was just too high and awkward. The bed and linens were below average and the pillows were definitely very old, as they were extremely flat. The shower had very low water pressure. In fact, I think the sink faucet had more water flow and pressure than the shower. I was on the third floor, close to the elevator and the stairs, right above the fireplace downstairs and there was a definite smell in the hallway that other people wrote about, but I couldn't smell it in the room. I could however, very clearly hear every word being spoken in the hallway, even when I could tell that people were trying to be quiet. There was also a substantial gap between the door and the floor which let in a lot of light in the night. Lastly, the temperature controls were not very good. Sometimes the room was too hot and sometimes too cold and the basic warm/cool control in the room did very little to change the temperature. Verdict: Hotel Griffon tries very hard, but is average. It is probably better to stay in an upgraded, guaranteed King room with a view, but for those prices I would just stay somewhere else, especially with two people in a room. Don't even think about roll away beds or having kids with you!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Thysworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October and really enjoyed it. The room, although extremely small, was clean and charming. Maybe a room with a view might make a difference in staying here again - we had the view of a brick wall. But the location was great!! And it beats staying someplace like the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Think you could do better”
Reviews.Author: jessue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Griffon for two nights back in March of 2005. Basically, I feel there is nothing wrong with the hotel. It has a certain "charm" because it is an old building. I did notice the sloping floors as I headed towards the elevator, but our room itself did not have a problem. The room was small, but nice, and we did not have any problem with musty smells at all. There is only one major complaint I have regarding this hotel. Although they have indoor parking at a price, it is a good block away and, worse than that, it is the most cramped, horrible, parking environment I have ever encountered in a parking garage. Without maneuvering several different times you cannot get into or out of any of the spaces. That being said, if you don't have a car to park, The Griffon is an okay hotel, but I think you could do better for the money. Try the Petite Auberge and get a fireplace room and a fantastic breakfast, including wine and appetizers in the evening for the same price. And yes, Petite Auberge has valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't stay here again. We had a harbor view room, the view was great, but the room was incredibly noisy and also incredibly small. Sink in the room, nothing terribly impressive about the room, although the bed was comfy. Carpet was stained, bathroom nothing special. Not surprisingly, the rooms look much better on their web-site. The staff was helpful, the continental breakfast a nice touch, but that is about it! If you like the location the Harbor Court Hotel is next door.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively pleasant stay, though a bit odd”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business overnight. Overall, I had a nice stay, though this hotel is a bit quirky. I was booked into room 411. This room features a queen size bed and small couch in an L shaped room. There are nice amenities such as bathrobes, nice sheets, nice toiletries. What was odd about this room is that there are some definite settling issues. Somewhat to be expected for an old hotel, but the room noticably slants uphill towards the bed. So much, in fact, that the nightstand and desk drawers do not stay shut. Another oddity is that the television is mounted very high on the wall. It makes for awkward viewing and craning your neck. This room may not be ideal for a longer stay because there is no dresser in the room. If I had to choose between a couch or a dresser, I would have probably picked a dresser because the location of the couch does not allow you to watch television. Oh, and because of the couch, the closet door does not open all the way. There was no iron or ironing board in the room, but when I called for one, it was promptly delivered. Service was quite efficient, and the complimentary continental breakfast was very good. Overall, I had a nice stay. I've had better, had worse. There are plenty of boutique hotels in San Francisco that are much better.
